title: US presidential debate: 'Trump is not the same person he was in 2020 or 2016. He's more extreme, darker'
summary: Le Monde's Washington correspondent Piotr Smolar answered readers' questions after the debate between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

title: Trump rules out holding another TV debate with Harris, accuses ABC moderator of looking at him 'with hatred in her eyes'
summary: The Democratic candidate put Trump on the defensive in their ABC News-hosted clash on Tuesday, watched by 67 million people. Almost immediately, her campaign called for a second showdown in October, but Trump shared his view on Thursday that only a 'prizefighter who loses a fight' would 'want a rematch.'

title: Maduro's electoral robbery tells a sad story: A country's collapse
summary: The outgoing president's self-proclaimed re-election illustrates the Chavist drift of the regime, a mixture of brutal, incompetent and corrupt autocracy, a source of trafficking of all kinds.

title: Ukraine's allies are split on whether to allow their missiles to strike deep into Russia
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and British Foreign Secretary David Lammy were in Kyiv on Wednesday. The Ukrainian government has been urging its allies to open up the use of long-range missiles in Russia.

title: The EU and the US' fight against the digital giants is 'a long march'
summary: A spate of competition rulings against Google or Apple suggests a tougher stance, but the authorities' fight against the big tech companies remains slow and difficult, writes Alexandre Piquard in his column.

title: Deauville American Film Festival forced into a post-#MeToo transformation
summary: The annual film festival in Normandy is celebrating its 50th edition, albeit shaken by controversy.

title: Toronto Film Festival drops 'Russians at War' film screenings over 'significant' threats
summary: 'This is an unprecedented move for TIFF,' read a statement from festival organizers, adding: 'Given the severity of these concerns, we cannot proceed as planned.'

title: Polish Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski: 'Ukraine's capacity to endure is not infinite'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the Polish head of diplomacy, who visits Kyiv on Thursday, justifies the need to allow Kyiv to strike military targets on Russian territory with long-range missiles.

title: In Singapore, Pope Francis celebrates the success of a multi-ethnic city
summary: On the final leg of his Asian tour, Pope Francis sang the praises of the powerful state known for its diversity.

title: Paul Marshall, the UK's new Conservative media mogul
summary: The 65-year-old businessman and founder of GBNews, the ‘British Fox News,’ has just scored a major coup by acquiring the ’The Spectator,’ a politically conservative and highly influential British weekly magazine.

title: Senegal President Faye announces dissolution of parliament
summary: Along with his Prime Minister Ousmane Sonko, Faye ran on a ticket of sovereignty and leftist pan-Africanism, raising the hopes of young people in a country where three-quarters of the population is under 35.

title: French mass rape trial adjourned to Monday as Dominique Pelicot ill
summary: Presiding judge Roger Arata said if Dominique Pelicot, accused of drugging his wife so dozens of men could rape her, was absent from court for a lengthy period of time, the trial would be 'postponed.'

title: Brigitte Macron awarded damages from women who spread false claim she is transgender
summary: Amandine Roy and Natacha Rey will have to pay €8,000 in damages to France's first lady and €5,000 to her brother Jean-Michel Trogneux.

title: Paris 2024: As venues get dismantled, the 'enchanted interlude' comes to an end
summary: The various competition venues for the Olympic and Paralympic Games must now be returned to their original state by the organizing committee.

title: From Guinea to Chad, floods affect 3.5 million people, killing nearly 900
summary: These new severe weather events have hit areas where the situation is already catastrophic due to food insecurity and conflict.

title: Ukraine says Russia has started a counteroffensive at Kursk border region
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky did not provide details on the extent of Russian operations in the region. Meanwhile, in eastern Ukraine, Zelensky said Thursday three aid workers were killed by shelling.

title: Macron's long-serving finance minister bows out of French politics
summary: Bruno Le Maire has served as finance and economy minister since Macron became president in May 2017, the only senior minister to have stayed on for that duration.

title: Car blast kills four in Israeli city of Ramla, say local police
summary: Israel's emergency medical service said the vehicle 'exploded while parked on a sidewalk.' According to a report from a paramedic on the scene, one of the victims was a one-month-old baby.

title: Ethiopia, the first country in the world to ban the import of gasoline and diesel vehicles
summary: Addis Ababa has banned the import of combustion-powered vehicles which will force drivers to switch to electric vehicles in a country with only one public charging station on its territory.
